definition: Chinese character (Hanzi)/the native script used to write a nation's language
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: "We should also look to our organizational problems when talking about the national team's poor performance," Wei said at his first news conference since taking the job.
sentences.chinese: 韦迪表示，国字号成绩如此之差，有足协组织的问题。

sentences.english: Within the country you fight for is the word in English to tell me?
sentences.chinese: 你们打的是内国字，用英语告诉我？

definition: to correct an erroneously written character/regular script (calligraphy)/standard form (of a character or spelling)
name of "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85)/see also 氵[shui3]
name of "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 訁|讠[yan2]
name of "cover" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 14)/see also 冖[mi4]
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
(colloquial) grapheme 攵 (variant form of Kangxi radical 66, 攴)
